heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 21 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.0°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 556 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 50.3°C), dew point temperature (up 45.2°C), outside temperature (up 49.6°C), and cloud levels (up 1095 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 556.4m lower than yesterday, 1095.1m lower than the past week, 711.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 929m and a high of 2240m, averaging 988.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 0.9°C higher than yesterday, 1.2°C higher than the past week, 45.2°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures for yesterday ranged from -2.8°C to 9.4°C and averaged 5.8°C, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

pressure.description:
Today’s average pressure is 0.2 mbar higher than yesterday, 2.8 mbar lower than the past week, 988.8 mbar higher than the past month.

The pressures yesterday fell between 1016 mbar minimum and 1021 mbar maximum, with an average of 1018.6 mbar; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1021.4 mbar and 29.8 mbar.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dark. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
